pullRequest.title: SONARJAVA-3374 Rule S5804 allowing user enumeration is security-sensitive

nodes.bodyText: Why not making it private static final. I feel this is a constant. (same comment for the next one as well)

According to the rule description, it should be authorized to throw such an exception if we are within the body of the loadUserByUsername method. I don't see check over this case, and it would therefore report FPs.

What about using LiteralUtils.isFalse(tree) here?
I also feel that we might be missing cases of constants, such as:
daoauth.setHideUserNotFoundExceptions(MY_CONSTANT);

From an expressionTree, you can probably call asConstant(Boolean.class), and it might work.
no need of extra space here.
why not calling it simply firstArgument ?
I'm a bit surprised not having a code smell here, I would have expected an issue to be raised by java:S115 on constants not using upper case names, as convention. Could you fix it?
